intro: Tripleurospermum karjaginii, commonly known as the Karjagin's goatweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
